I evaluate my hole cards A♥ 9♠ on the 8♣ 6♥ 7♣ flop with over-cards.  
The flop brings coordinated straight draws and my over-cards have back-door nut-flush and broad-way straight possibilities, but no made hand yet. The pot stands at 170, opponent has bet 70 into it (≈2.4 pot odds), giving me 29% equity needed to call.

A high card value plus gut-shot straight potential (any 10 or 5 would complete my straight and give me the nut straight), plus back-door Broadway straight and nut flush draws justify a call here.

[Call]
